chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
TraverseRelative

Premises:
recognize_subst : TraverseFunctorial -> TraverseIdentifiesVar -> TraverseRelative -> TraverseRelative -> forall traverse_ : (nat -> nat -> ty) -> nat -> ty -> ty, traverse_ = traverse -> forall (v : ty) (k2 k1 : nat) (t : ty), traverse_ (fun l x : nat => subst_idx (lift l 0 v) (l + k2) x) k1 t = subst (lift k1 0 v) (k1 + k2) t

traverse_extensional : TraverseRelative -> forall f g : nat -> nat -> ty, (forall l x : nat, f l x = g l x) -> forall (t : ty) (l : nat), traverse f l t = traverse g l t
traverse_traverse_var : TraverseFunctorial -> TraverseRelative -> TraverseIdentifiesVar -> forall (f : nat -> nat -> nat) (g : nat -> nat -> ty) (t : ty) (l : nat), traverse g l (traverse_var f l t) = traverse (fun l0 x : nat => g l0 (f l0 x)) l t
recognize_lift : TraverseRelative -> forall (w k1 k2 : nat) (t : ty) (traverse_ : (nat -> nat -> ty) -> nat -> ty -> ty), traverse_ = traverse -> traverse_ (fun l x : nat => var (lift w (l + k2) x)) k1 t = lift w (k1 + k2) t

ssrfun.involutive : forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> Prop
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.lt_succ_diag_r : forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n (BinInt.Z.succ n)
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
subst = fun (V T : Type) (Subst0 : Subst V T) => let (subst) := Subst0 in subst : forall V T : Type, Subst V T -> V -> nat -> T -> T Arguments subst {V T}%type_scope {Subst} _ _%nat_scope
ssreflect.abstract_lock = unit : Set
BinNat.N.le_0_2 = BinNat.N.lt_le_incl BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) BinNat.N.lt_0_2 : BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH))
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.opp_le_mono : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m < -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.opp m) (BinInt.Z.opp n)
OrderedRing.sor_setoid_Reflexive : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> RelationClasses.Reflexive req
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker = fun (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) => Tauto.tauto_checker ZMicromega.Zunsat ZMicromega.Zdeduce ZMicromega.normalise ZMicromega.negate (fun cl : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * unit) => ZMicromega.ZChecker (List.map fst cl)) f w : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z) -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker _ _%list_scope
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n + m) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m)
RingMicromega.PsatzAdd : forall C : Type, RingMicromega.Psatz C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C -> RingMicromega.Psatz C
BinNat.N.one_succ = eq_refl : BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH = BinNat.N.succ BinNums.N0
